title: "What are the experiences of those affected by Donato's magnetic fascination in the 1880s?"
first_phrase: The text is a collection of testimonies and experiences on the topic of hypnotism and magnetism, particularly the work of an individual named Donato in the late 1800s. The last 200 tokens feature the perspective of Auguste Queff, a soldier who initially attended Donato's sessions as a skeptic but later came to believe in his abilities. Queff describes his experiences under Donato's influence and attempts to explain the sensations he felt using terms related to magnetism. The text as a whole provides an interesting look at the fascination with hypnotism that was prevalent at the time and the various reactions and interpretations of those who were involved with it.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the death of Alfred de Caston was indeed mourned by his supporters and followers, his legacy still lives on through the works and articles he left behind. It is important to note that his ideas and theories have been the subject of study and debate for many years, as evidenced by the numerous publications and articles referencing his techniques and practices. Furthermore, his influence extended beyond the realm of journalism and into the world of science and medicine, with experts like Dr. Ochorowitz and Dr. Espinouse contributing their own insights on the controversial topic of magnetic fascination. Whether one is a believer or a skeptic, there is no denying that the life and work of Alfred de Caston continue to fascinate and intrigue to this day.
